Molecular Programming Project

The fundamental principles of computer science have allowed us to master electronic systems with billions of components and software with millions of lines of code to do amazingly complex tasks.

Learn More

NUPACK:
nucleic acid package

DNA nanostructure
design with caDNAno

Multiplexed super-resolution
fluorescence microscopy

Compartmentalized
biochemical reaction networks

gro: the cell
programming language

Programmable chemical
controllers made from DNA

Digital computation with DNA
strand-displacement cascades

Self-assembly of DNA
origami into 3D shapes

DNA bricks: complex 3D structures
from short synthetic strands

Our Mission

Our long-term vision is to establish molecular programming as a subdiscipline of computer science—one that will enable a yet-to-be imagined array of applications from chemical circuitry for interacting with biological molecules to nanoscale computing and molecular robotics.
